summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June/early July 2020 concerning operational planning and approval for travel to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, believed to be Ghislaine Maxwell, who was located in New Hampshire. The emails discuss shifting resources, obtaining GPS data, and coordinating the arrest notification.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent in New York
persons.context: Communicates about shifting operational focus to New Hampshire based on phone data and requests approval for moving technical assets and associated expenses.

persons.name: SSA Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent at Headquarters
persons.context: Requests immediate notification of the arrest and any significant activity to submit a Significant Case Notification (SCN).

connections.description: SSA FBI New York is requesting travel approval from M for an arrest operation.

connections.person2: SSA Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
connections.description: They are coordinating on the arrest operation, with the HQ SSA requesting updates from the New York SSA.

events.title: Operational Shift to New Hampshire
events.description: FBI analysis of historical phone data indicates the target (Maxwell) is in New Hampshire, requiring a shift in operational planning away from Massachusetts.

events.title: Travel Request for Arrest Operation
events.description: An FBI agent requests approval for travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, involving a team of four driving up and possibly escorting the target back to New York.

events.title: Request to Move Technical Assets
events.description: SSA FBI New York requests approval to move technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone, incurring lodging expenses.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in late June 2020, initially believing she was in Massachusetts.
Historical phone data placed Maxwell in New Hampshire, causing a significant shift in operational planning.
The operation involved moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to locate Maxwell's phone.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit required immediate notification of the arrest to file a Significant Case Notification (SCN).
The travel plan involved a team of four agents driving, with estimated expenses totaling $1060 for hotel, per diem, and parking.
